intro: Salaxis triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered salaxis, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
